title: Executive Order 5098-Reserving Certain Described Lands in Wyoming for Resurvey
content: Under authority contained in the act of June 25, 1910 (36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (37 Stat. 497), and subject to the conditions, provisions and limitations of said acts, it is hereby ordered that the public lands in Ts. 42, 43 and 44 N., Rs. 87 and 88 W., 6th P. M., Wyoming, be and the same are hereby withdrawn from settlement, location, sale, entry and all forms of appropriation, pending a resurvey of said townships under the act of May 29, 1908 (35 Stat. 465).
This order shall continue in full force and effect unless and until revoked by the President, or by an act of Congress.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5098-Reserving Certain Described Lands in Wyoming for Resurvey Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/372837
